semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Using Category I69 with Current Cerebrovascular Disease Codes
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 9. Diseases of the Circulatory System > d. Sequelae of Cerebrovascular Disease > 2) Codes from category I69 with codes from I60-I67

content.full_text: Codes from category I69 may be assigned on a health care record with codes from I60-I67, if the patient has a current cerebrovascular disease and deficits from an old cerebrovascular disease. (Evidence: pg no: 53, L74-L77)
content.summary: Guidelines allowing concurrent use of I69 sequelae codes with current cerebrovascular disease codes I60-I67 (Evidence: pg no: 53, L74-L77)
key_concepts: Concurrent I69 and I60-I67 coding (Evidence: pg no: 53, L74-L75)
Current cerebrovascular disease (Evidence: pg no: 53, L75-L76)
Old cerebrovascular disease deficits (Evidence: pg no: 53, L76-L77)

detailed_rules.rule_text: May use I69 codes with I60-I67 codes concurrently (Evidence: pg no: 53, L74-L75)
detailed_rules.explanation: Codes from category I69 may be assigned on the same health care record with codes from I60-I67 under specific circumstances (Evidence: pg no: 53, L74-L75)
common_applications: New stroke with old stroke deficits

detailed_rules.rule_text: Requires current CVD and deficits from old CVD (Evidence: pg no: 53, L75-L77)
detailed_rules.explanation: Concurrent coding is appropriate when patient has current cerebrovascular disease and deficits from an old cerebrovascular disease (Evidence: pg no: 53, L75-L77)
common_applications: New stroke in patient with old stroke deficits

workflow_steps: Step 2: Identify deficits from old cerebrovascular disease
Step 3: Assign appropriate I60-I67 code for current condition
Step 4: Assign appropriate I69 code for old deficits

code_ranges.description: Sequelae of cerebrovascular disease (Evidence: pg no: 53, L74-L75)
code_ranges.requirement: Use for deficits from old cerebrovascular disease
usage_rules: May be used with I60-I67 codes (Evidence: pg no: 53, L74-L75)

code_ranges.description: Current cerebrovascular diseases (Evidence: pg no: 53, L75-L76)
usage_rules: May be used with I69 codes when appropriate (Evidence: pg no: 53, L74-L77)

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with new stroke and residual deficits from previous stroke
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Acute cerebral infarction, patient has left hemiparesis from previous stroke 2 years ago
step_by_step: Step 2: Identify left hemiparesis from old stroke
Step 3: Assign I63.9 for current stroke
Step 4: Assign I69.352 for old stroke sequelae

correct_coding.rationale: Patient has both current cerebrovascular disease and deficits from old disease (Evidence: pg no: 53, L75-L77)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Would miss the ongoing deficits from previous stroke
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Not coding residual deficits from previous events

best_practices: Code both current disease and old deficits when present (Evidence: pg no: 53, L75-L77)
common_mistakes: Not coding residual deficits from previous strokes
Confusing current and old cerebrovascular events
tips: Distinguish between current disease and old deficits (Evidence: pg no: 53, L75-L77)
